@graph.name: Arroz con Pollo - Chicken and Rice Recipe - A Cozy Kitchen
@graph.description: Arroz con Pollo is a comforting, one-pot meal from Latin America. This version is a family favorite and is a cross between paella and arroz con pollo.

@graph.name: Adrianna Adarme
@graph.description: A Cozy Kitchen is a recipe blog written by Adrianna Adarme. Adrianna likes corgis, pancakes and cute things.

@graph.name: Arroz con Pollo Recipe
@graph.description: Arroz con Pollo is a comforting, one-pot meal from Latin America. This version is a family favorite and is a cross between paella and arroz con pollo.
recipeIngredient: 1 tablespoon neutral oil  ((I like to use avocado oil) )
2 cups medium grain rice  ((see below for more options) )

recipeInstructions.text: Sprinkle both sides of the chicken with salt
recipeInstructions.name: Sprinkle both sides of the chicken with salt

recipeInstructions.text: In a Dutch oven, heat oil over medium-high heat. When oil is hot, add chicken, skin side down, until browned, about 5 to 7 minutes. Flip the chicken, using tongs, and cook on opposite side until golden brown, about 5 minutes. Transfer to plate and set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: In a Dutch oven, heat oil over medium-high heat. When oil is hot, add chicken, skin side down, until browned, about 5 to 7 minutes. Flip the chicken, using tongs, and cook on opposite side until golden brown, about 5 minutes. Transfer to plate and set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: Reduce heat to medium, add onion and red bell pepper, and cook until translucent, about 7 minutes. Add garlic to the top of the onions and cook until fragrant; 2 minutes or so. Add the tomato and scrape the bottom of the pot removing any of the chicken fat pieces (hello! flavor!!). Next, add spices: cumin, paprika, turmeric, saffron, crushed red pepper and 1 1/2 teaspoons of kosher salt and mix.
recipeInstructions.name: Reduce heat to medium, add onion and red bell pepper, and cook until translucent, about 7 minutes. Add garlic to the top of the onions and cook until fragrant; 2 minutes or so. Add the tomato and scrape the bottom of the pot removing any of the chicken fat pieces (hello! flavor!!). Next, add spices: cumin, paprika, turmeric, saffron, crushed red pepper and 1 1/2 teaspoons of kosher salt and mix.

recipeInstructions.text: Pour in rice and give it a good mix, coating it with the tomato mixture. Cook for about a minute or so. Place chicken atop of rice mixture, and disperse the olives all around atop the rice.
recipeInstructions.name: Pour in rice and give it a good mix, coating it with the tomato mixture. Cook for about a minute or so. Place chicken atop of rice mixture, and disperse the olives all around atop the rice.

recipeInstructions.text: Pour just enough chicken stock to cover the rice, about 3 1/2 cups. Bring the pot to a simmer and then reduce heat to low. Cook, covered, for about 30 to 34 minutes, and until rice is tender.
recipeInstructions.name: Pour just enough chicken stock to cover the rice, about 3 1/2 cups. Bring the pot to a simmer and then reduce heat to low. Cook, covered, for about 30 to 34 minutes, and until rice is tender.

recipeInstructions.text: Note: Throughout the cooking process, I checked on it every 15 minutes or so and topped it off with about 1/4 cup of stock each time. In the end, I added 4 cups of chicken stock total. Also, in the last 15 minutes, I salted to taste, adding about 1/4 teaspoon more salt.
recipeInstructions.name: Note: Throughout the cooking process, I checked on it every 15 minutes or so and topped it off with about 1/4 cup of stock each time. In the end, I added 4 cups of chicken stock total. Also, in the last 15 minutes, I salted to taste, adding about 1/4 teaspoon more salt.

recipeInstructions.text: When it's ready, turn the heat off. Sprinkle the peas on top and cover with a lid for 2 minutes. Just until the peas are thawed and bright green. Serve immediately.
recipeInstructions.name: When it's ready, turn the heat off. Sprinkle the peas on top and cover with a lid for 2 minutes. Just until the peas are thawed and bright green. Serve immediately.

recipeInstructions.text: Leftovers: This stays good in the fridge for up to 3 days. It's great reheated in the microwave. You may need to add a splash of water to it to loosen it up right before the microwave!
recipeInstructions.name: Leftovers: This stays good in the fridge for up to 3 days. It's great reheated in the microwave. You may need to add a splash of water to it to loosen it up right before the microwave!

@graph.keywords: arroz con pollo peruano, arroz con pollo receta, como hacer arroz con pollo, easy arroz con pollo
